oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Practical Approach to Fluid Therapy
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mongini, Frank A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: I'm sure all of you recognize the necessity of intravenous fluids as a therapeutic means in the treatment of many disease conditions. The major factors preventing us from utilizing fluids as frequently as we'd like, is usually either the cost of the fluids, or the time and effort spent in administration. With these problems in mind, we have attempted and I feel succeeded in arriving at a fluid that is balanced and a means of administration that is efficient.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1973; 45-46
